results.title: Bye bye Birdie
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Fred Kohlmar, Columbia Pictures and Kohlmar-Sidney Productions
results.brief_description: When a singer is drafted, a songwriter and his girlfriend decide to capitalize on the event. On national TV, Conrad Birdie will sing a song to a lucky teenager. Cast includes Janet Leigh, Dick Van Dyke, Ann-Margret, Maureen Stapleton, Bobby Rydell, Jesse Pearson and Ed Sullivan as himself. Based upon the play “Bye, bye, Birdie”, book by Michael Stewart with music and lyrics by Charles Strouse and Lee Adams.

results.title: Dancers
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Yoram Globus, Menahem Golan, Baryshnikov Productions, Hera Productions and Golan-Globus
results.brief_description: Mikhail Baryshnikov, one of the world’s greatest and most admired ballet dancers stars in this romantic drama about an American ballet company’s arrival in Italy to perform the romantic ballet ‘Giselle’. Baryshnikov plays Tony (Anton) Sergeyev, lead dancer and director of the production, ladies’ man, experienced and charming who finds himself attracted to the newest member of his troupe, the young and naive American teenager Lisa (Julie Kent). Art begins to mirror life as the drama of love and betrayal of ‘Giselle’ is played out backstage between Tony and Lisa. Features the dancers of the American Ballet Theater, Allesandra Ferri (Francesca), Leslie Browne (Nadine) and Mariangela Melato (the Contessa). ‘Giselle’ is conducted by Michael Tilson Thomas and performed by the London Symphony Orchestra, original music by Pino Donaggio.

results.title: The Children of Theatre Street
results.creator_credit: Earle Mack, Robert Dornhelm and Kultur International Films
results.brief_description: Describes life at the Vaganova Choreographic Institute in Leningrad (also known as the Kirov School of Leningrad), formerly the Imperial Ballet School of Russia, which has spawned dancers like Nureyev, Pavlova, Nijinsky, Baryshnikov, and Balanchine. Here at the school, gifted students are trained in classical ballet, using methods that have much in common with the training of ballet students anywhere in the world. Narrated by Princess Grace of Monaco and features Galina Messenzeva and Konstantine Zaklinsky of the Kirov Ballet. Ballet performances filmed and recorded live at the Kirov, Bolshoi and Maly Theatres, USSR.

results.title: White nights
results.creator_credit: Taylor Hackford, William S. Gilmore, New Visions Pictures, Delphi V Productions and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: This Cold War thriller stars real-life dancer Mikhail Baryshnikov as a Russian defector who finds himself trapped in his homeland when his plane crashes in Siberia. Billeted with an American dancer (Gregory Hines), Kolya is desperate to escape and hatches a daring plan but must evade the keen attentions of the KGB. Whilst the plot is fair to middling, the dancing in this feature film is brilliant, making the most of the two lead’s spectacular talents. Also stars Helen Mirren and Isabella Rossellini.

results.title: Armageddon
results.creator_credit: Jerry Bruckheimer, Touchstone Pictures and Michael Bay
results.brief_description: Big budget sci-fiction thriller from director Michael Bay is nothing less than a glorious onslaught of thrills, explosions and entirely employable, if increasingly unlikely, scenarios. Negative reviews (deriding its extravagance and silliness) did nothing to dent its box office haul. Cast includes Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton, Liv Tyler, Ben Affleck, Will Patton, Owen Wilson, Steve Buscemi, Owen Wilson, Peter Stormare.

results.title: Blood of Dracula
results.creator_credit: Herbert L. Strock, Herman Cohen and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: Six weeks after her mother dies, Nancy Perkin’s father remarries, and she is reluctantly sent off to boarding school. There she falls under the evil spell of a teacher, who hypnotises her, converting Nancy to vampirism! In the third instalment of his horror trilogy (that includes “I was a teenage werewolf” and “I was a teenage Frankenstein” both 1957), producer Herman Cohen continues to trade on the themes of teen disenchantment and conflict between the rock and roll generation and their square parents. There is even a proto-feminist theme in this film, borne out by the ambitious teacher who seeks to prove herself in a man’s world. Predictably she meets a sticky end, not only as the villain of the piece, but also perhaps as a warning to meddlesome females.

results.title: Ivan's childhood = Ivanovo Detstvo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrei Tarkovsky, G Natanson and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Tarkovsky’s prize-winning debut feature is an extraordinarily moving view of war and revenge. Twelve year-old Ivan is determined to avenge his mother’s death, and he joins a Russian regiment as a scout. His ability to slip through enemy lines more easily than an adult makes him useful to the army, but, as his missions become increasingly dangerous, it is decided that he must be removed from the front line. Ivan resists and convinces his commanding officers to allow him to carry out one last expedition. The monochrome photography depicts Ivan’s war in a series of memorable sequences, and contributes to making this film one of cinema’s great statements on war. Also available on VHS [311666].

results.title: Come and see = Idi i smotri
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Highly acclaimed Russian feature about a young boy, living in occupied territory, who joins the partisans to fight against the Nazis. An expressionistic work of great beauty that depicts abject horror, the narrative, based on true events, is framed as a coming-of-age story. The protagonist, a survivor through chance, is forced to repeatedly witness the awfulness of genocide, rape, destruction and evil, robbing him of youth, innocence and trust. Unforgettably poetic scenes reflect the brutality of victory, magnified through the eyes of a child. Adapted from the book by Ales Adamovich.

results.title: The Dawns here are quiet = A Zori Zdes Tikhiye
results.creator_credit: Stanislav Rostotsky, G Natanson and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Set in WW2, Karelia, northwest Russia, this elegiac war drama is about a small group of female soldiers in training, who are unexpectedly called upon to face a Nazi patrol of paratroopers. The narrative sensitively portrays the women’s camaraderie, as well as their pre-war domestic life, and spousal relationships. A fine ensemble cast heads what is widely regarded as powerful statement about war and society, and the sacrifices of ordinary citizens made in extraordinary times. Based on a true story and adapted from the book by Boris Vasilyev. Also known as “At Dawn its quiet here” and “That Dawn should be peaceful”.

results.title: They fought for their motherland = Oni srazhalis za rodinu
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Epic film by Soviet filmmaker Sergei Bondarchuk, depicts the skirmishes faced by Russian troops, during the WW2 invasion of Stalingrad by the Germans. Impressive action sequences meticulously recreate the drama, danger, destruction and disorientation of war. Winner of the State Prize of the Russian Federation, 1977.
results.title_for_label: They fought for their motherland = Oni srazhalis za rodinu
